00025 #include "syx-memory.h"
00026 #include "syx-platform.h"
00027 #include "syx-types.h"
00028 #include "syx-object.h"
00029 #include "syx-bytecode.h"
00030 
00036 SyxBytecode *
00037 syx_bytecode_new (void)
00038 {
00039   SyxBytecode *bytecode;
00040 
00041   bytecode = (SyxBytecode *)syx_malloc (sizeof (SyxBytecode));
00042   bytecode->code_top = 0;
00043   bytecode->literals_top = 0;
00044   bytecode->stack_size = 0;
00045 
00046   return bytecode;
00047 }
00048 
00052 syx_symbol syx_bytecode_unary_messages[] = {"isNil", "notNil", "value", "new", "class", "superclass",
00053                                             "print", "printNl", "printString", "unity", NULL};
00054 
00058 syx_symbol syx_bytecode_binary_messages[] = {"+", "-", "<", ">", "<=", ">=", "=", "~=", "at:",
00059                                              "do:", "value:", "valueWithArguments:",
00060                                              "new:", "to:", "basicAt:", NULL};
00061 
00075 void
00076 syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (SyxBytecode *bytecode, syx_uint8 high, syx_uint16 low)
00077 {
00078   if (low > SYX_BYTECODE_ARGUMENT_MAX)
00079     {
00080       syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_EXTENDED, high);
00081       syx_bytecode_gen_code (bytecode, low);
00082     }
00083   else
00084     syx_bytecode_gen_code (bytecode, (high << SYX_BYTECODE_ARGUMENT_BITS) + low);
00085 }
00086 
00099 void
00100 syx_bytecode_gen_message (SyxBytecode *bytecode, syx_bool to_super, syx_uint32 argument_count, syx_symbol selector)
00101 {
00102   SyxOop binding;
00103   /*
00104   syx_int16 i;
00105   SyxOop selbinding;
00106   if (!to_super)
00107     {
00108       for (i=0; syx_bytecode_unary_messages[i]; i++)
00109         {
00110           if (!strcmp (syx_bytecode_unary_messages[i], selector))
00111             {
00112               binding = syx_variable_binding_new (syx_symbol_new (selector), 0, syx_nil);
00113               selbinding = syx_object_new (syx_globals_at ("Association"));
00114               SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (selbinding) = syx_small_integer_new (i);
00115               SYX_ASSOCIATION_VALUE (selbinding) = binding;
00116               syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_SEND_UNARY,
00117                                             syx_bytecode_gen_literal (bytecode, selbinding));
00118               return;
00119             }
00120         }
00121       
00122       for (i=0; syx_bytecode_binary_messages[i]; i++)
00123         {
00124           if (!strcmp (syx_bytecode_binary_messages[i], selector))
00125             {
00126               binding = syx_variable_binding_new (syx_symbol_new (selector), 0, syx_nil);
00127               selbinding = syx_object_new (syx_globals_at ("Association"));
00128               SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (selbinding) = syx_small_integer_new (i);
00129               SYX_ASSOCIATION_VALUE (selbinding) = binding;
00130               syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_SEND_BINARY,
00131                                             syx_bytecode_gen_literal (bytecode, selbinding));
00132               return;
00133             }
00134         } 
00135     }
00136   */
00137   binding = syx_variable_binding_new (syx_symbol_new (selector), 0, syx_nil);
00138   syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_MARK_ARGUMENTS, argument_count);
00139   if (to_super)
00140     syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_SEND_SUPER,
00141                                   syx_bytecode_gen_literal (bytecode, binding));
00142   else
00143     syx_bytecode_gen_instruction (bytecode, SYX_BYTECODE_SEND_MESSAGE,
00144                                   syx_bytecode_gen_literal (bytecode, binding));
00145 }
00146 
00155 syx_uint32
00156 syx_bytecode_gen_literal (SyxBytecode *bytecode, SyxOop literal)
00157 {
00158   syx_uint16 i;
00159   for (i=0; i < bytecode->literals_top; i++)
00160     {
00161       if (SYX_OOP_EQ (bytecode->literals[i], literal))
00162         return i;
00163     }
00164 
00165   if (SYX_IS_OBJECT (literal))
00166     SYX_OBJECT_IS_CONSTANT(literal) = TRUE;
00167 
00168   bytecode->literals[bytecode->literals_top++] = literal;
00169   return bytecode->literals_top - 1;
00170 }
